data.title: List of Christian Metal Bands
data.meta_description: A full list of Christian Metal bands. Updated as often as possible. There is no marking of genre or years active. This list was added so people could go find new bands. If you want some new Christian metal, then check this out. It includes several hardcore acts, which have a metal sound to them...
data.text:
A full list of Christian Metal bands. Updated as often as possible.

Description[]

There is no marking of genre or years active. This list was added so people could go find new bands. If you want some new Christian metal, then check this out. It includes several hardcore acts, which have a metal sound to them, so expect a few of those. Each one of these bands have a different system and genre and sound. We did not pick the names of these bands, so if you find something offensive, do not comment about it. The lyrical themes are all the same on the Christian spectrum, but there are several other lyrical themes that are interesting topics that I have nothing to do with.

One of these is a Christian/Catholic band that preaches Catholicism and there's another that is a Christian band but preaches against Catholicism. We personally have no problem with Catholicism. I hope you enjoy the list and get some new bands and playlists from this. God bless! Genres include heavy metal, melodic metal, death metal, unblack metal, progressive metal, power metal, thrash metal, metalcore, metallic hardcore and every little subgenre beneath (Progressive death metal, deathgrind, thrashcore, etc.). This is for all the kids whose parents want them to listen to the "safe" stuff. Here's your reference list.

* signifies that they are Christians in a band

** signifies that they were once a Christian band or Christians-in-a-band and are no longer. Generally due to member changes, so most of them are safe. I'll have notes at the bottom

*** signifies that they went from Non/Anti-Christian band to a Christian band

Additional Notes[]

The bands marked as Christians in a band are safe. They do not preach against the gospel or anything like that. Usually they are rather positive bands

The Order of Elijah is the only unsafe band at this point. They totally switched sides. Do not get anything after Dethrone.

Vengeance Rising released two other "satanic albums" after Roger Martinez went off the deep end. They are extremely hard to find, but when searching for their records, remember that Human Sacrifice, Once Dead, Destruction Comes and Released Upon the Earth are the official Christian discography.

Ad Christi Gloriam and The Empty Tomb were never Christian projects, despite their appearance. They were simply Christian inspired according to their founders.

There is a few bands that have lyrical themes of Christianity or Biblical Themes not included due to the artwork or labels they are apart of. We will look into it more until a more decisive decision is made.
